page.title: 16ARTISTS IN PUTTENHAM
page.content: Puttenham is a small village with less than six hundred inhabitants but several artists have chosen to live and work amongst its old cottages and farmhouses. In 1977 the group decided to celebrate the{Queen's Jubilee}by presenting to the church a series of paintings, reliefs, carvings and weaving. There are eight pictures which show the church's history. The pictures may be seen today in the church. The Artists -{Charles Bone, landscape painter in water colour and oils,{Marion Smith,}sculptor and painter,{Sheila Mitchell,}portrait sculptor,{Faith Winter,}sculptor in stone, wood and bronze,{Edward {Truefitt,}a scientist whose hobby was painting,{Jill Truefitt, weaver,{R.G.Vevers,}farmer and slate carver,{David Winter,}sculptor of miniatures,{Alice Winter,}sculptor.
